card.note: It is rare to have the opportunity to work with someone as committed as Marilyn. Since I've joined the board, I've witnessed Marilyn give 110% everyday to our organization. She is smart, dedicated, passionate and most of all caring. I wish you the best my friend!
card.author: Jodi Robinson

card.note: Marilyn I wish I had become involved with Wayside Waifs earlier so I would have had the opportunity to get to know you better. However your commitment to Wayside's mission and the animals it serves is clear and you will be missed
card.author: David Morris & Family

card.note: Marilyn../R/RIt has been an absolute pleasure to have know and worked with you over the last several years. /R/RWishing you rest, peace, love, and happiness in your retirement. /R
card.author: Mike Tracy

card.note: I had the privilege of working with Marilyn during 2004 at MOCSA. I have been with the company for 14 years, but learned more from Marilyn than any other boss. She respected and believed in me, and made me feel good about myself. But above all, she was my friend!!
card.author: Sharon Booker

card.note: Oh, the changes you & I have seen.We have worked side by side for many years. We accountants are always behind the scenes & you were there providing steady guidance & strength as Wayside grew into the organization it currently is. Thank you. Enjoy retirement, my friend.
card.author: Melanie Hepperly

card.note: Marilyn, through my MANY years on the Wayside Board, you've been our "budget guru"...the person in whom we had complete confidence because of your attention to detail and your unwavering dedication to helping us be the best in the business!
card.author: Susan Wally

card.note: Thank you, Marilyn, for all your service and dedication to Wayside Waifs.
card.author: Sherry Forsee

card.note: Marilyn is the world's greatest clogger./RWe all love her and are so glad that she started clogging. If not we probably would not have ever met her. She is a hugh asset to The Cowtown Cloggers. Love you Marilyn.
card.author: Cowtown Cloggers

card.note: Marilyn: I will miss you so much. I always knew I could come to you with a question, problem or just for congenial conversation. Your contributions to Wayside are too numerous to name. I wish you all the best in retirement. Please come see us often. God bless you!/R
card.author: Pam Dooley

card.note: Marilyn, I warmly recall working with you and your joie de vivre--especially the dancing! I hope you have ample opportunity for that and other fun things in your retirement.
card.author: Palle Rilinger

card.note: Marilyn,/R/RI will miss you so much, it has been great to get to know you over the past 2 years. I hope to see you around Wayside from time to time. Keep in touch!
card.author: Amanda

card.note: I'm so glad to have had the honor of working with you. Thank you for being a mentor and a constant inspiration to me. I hope to stay in contact, and will truly miss you. Good luck!
card.author: Ashley McCoy

card.note: I owe my promotion less to my qualifications and more to the support of helpful colleagues like you. Congratulations to a wonderful, fabulous lady./R/R
card.author: Ronnie Laree Wise

card.note: Marilyn, I have asked you thousands of questions and you have always been patient and provided guidance...even when the answer was no! Thank you for all you have done. We always laughed at sending each other pictures of food so don't forget to send me one now and then!
card.author: Barry Baranowski

card.note: Marilyn,/RIt was a pleasure to work with you. I love your spirit, your strength, and the way you care about Wayside. I will never forget your enthusiasm when you gave me my new board member tour, you show the same today! Looking forward to sharing some retirement fun!
card.author: All the best for you, Ellen Hanson

card.note: Marilyn,/RI have admired and learned from your commitment to excellence at Wayside. You could always account for every single penny! You have been a joy to work with. I wish you the very best in retirement. I hope we still get to see you around!
card.author: Shannon Barks

card.note: Whenever I think of you the first thing that comes to mind is your clogging. I have not met anyone before who clogs so that makes you special! How does one even get started or interested in clogging?!
card.author: John Ritter

card.note: To a fellow GKCCF survivor, congratulations on your retirement. Now you will have more time to alphabetize your canned goods. :))
card.author: Carolyne

card.note: Marilyn,/RThank you for getting me off to good start at Wayside Waifs and all that you have done for Wayside and other organizations.
card.author: Andrew Starr

card.note: Marilyn/R/RIt was a pleasure working with you at the Community Foundation. I always enjoyed hearing your laugh! Sorry I was unable to make it to your party but I do wish you the best in retirement!
card.author: Jodi Adams

card.note: Marilyn, I admire /Ryour leadership and love for Wayside! You have always run a highly successful tight ship. We all love you and will miss you greatly my friend. My Best to you - - - Chris Trainer
card.author: Chris Trainer

card.note: Happy retirement, dear Marilyn! You were always so fun (and expert!) to work with. I just never understood driving to Springfield to get your hair cut!? Wishing you every blessing in this new part of your life & sending love
card.author: Annie Heck

card.note: I'm very happy for you Marilyn. I'm sure you have wonderful plans beyond your retirement that will be as fulfilling as it has been with Wayside Waifs. Thank you for your dedicated service for our community.
card.author: Walt Lane

card.note: Many thanks for your dedication and service to the homeless pets at Wayside, Marilyn. Wishing you a wonderful, fulfilling retirement!
card.author: Jan Kyle & Wayne Hunthausen

card.note: Marilyn, I have enjoyed working with you over the past several years. If there was ever a question I needed an answer to, you were always there with the answer. I'm going to miss you and your smile. My best to you in your new role as a retired Wayside Waifer.
card.author: Harold Melcher

card.note: Hi Marilyn, we are looking forward to lunches and shopping, with no eye on the clock.
card.author: Carolyn Osgood & Caroline Jeffries

card.note: Marilyn--thanks for all of your help. I always appreciated the fact the we had good financial information./R
card.author: Peter Brown

card.note: It’s been great working with you and getting to know you, Marilyn! I appreciate your constant willingness to cheerfully assist me. Your positive outlook and upbeat disposition made working with you a pleasure. Thanks for everything! I’ll miss you! Please keep in touch.
card.author: Karen

card.note: Congratulations on your lengthy career and everything you have accomplished! You have achieved a lot. Enjoy your retirement.
card.author: Casey McDonald

card.note: Marilyn has always been the person I turned to for figuring it out and getting it done. We have had an amazing career working in different agencies and grappling with different issues. I am, as always, so appreciative of Marilyn's dedication, commitment, and tenacity.
card.author: Patti Glass

card.note: Marilyn,/R/RVery best of luck and thank you for all your service to Wayside. You are an inspiration!
card.author: Gary Wolf

card.note: I had the pleasure of working with you for many years at JF&CS. During those years, we shared many professional and personal accomplishments and challenges. Time can't take away my memories that are filled with smiles. I wish you a happy retirement filled with fun.
card.author: Karen Agron Flattery

card.note: Multi-talented, Ambitious, Romantic, Incredible, Loving, Young-at-heart, Nuturing = MARILYN
card.author: Love Kirt and Susan

card.note: Marilyn is a very caring person who I will miss greatly. She has made me feel very welcome in the Finance Department and I am thankful I got to work closely with Marilyn in these past months.
card.author: Sharon Kelly

card.note: Marilyn, you have always been so wonderful! Anytime I had a question, you always had time to answer it or to provide an explanation. You are always smiling, polite and kind. I will miss seeing daily at Wayside, but I look forward to seeing you as a volunteer!
card.author: All the best to you! - Bonnie Still

card.note: Dear Marilyn,/RI will always fondly remember our work together on the audit of the Jewish Family Services so many years ago. I still use the Mary Kay lotion that you introduced me to so my hands could be more smooth for my new baby. Love every day of retirement!
card.author: Sharon Latimer

card.note: We wish you all the best in this new chapter of your life. Thank you for all the support, guidance and laughter over the years. Our family is always here for you! /RAbove all remember to always #enjoythemoment.
card.author: David, Trish, Fiona & Gavin Cross

card.note: I am so glad I had the chance to work with you these past years! Good luck in everything you do!
card.author: Elise Mann

card.note: I will miss my "bean counter"!
card.author: Sarah

card.note: We can never thank you enough for your expertise, caring and enthusiasm for the animals and people at Wayside Waifs./RThank you, thank you, thank you./RMarilyn Creager
card.author: Tom and Betty Scott

card.note: Marilyn, How fortunate I have been to have crossed your path at WW. Wayside has been blessed to have you in the many roles, not just being on top of all things financial....you are always there to lend a hand or ear for all...you are the calm in our hectic days.
card.author: Randy Clark

card.note: Thank you for all you have done for Wayside. Your smiling face and vast knowledge of our organization and history will be sorely missed. Happy Retirement!
card.author: Sandy Johnson

card.note: Marilyn, I am hoping you will enjoy your retirement as much as I enjoy mine. It may take a few months but I predict you'll wake up one day & say, "I'm too busy -- I finally do have it all!" Happy Trails To You.....
card.author: Barbara Lawson

card.note: Marilyn - I hope you enjoy retirement ... you've certainly earned it! Wayside has been lucky to have you all these years. Best wishes.
card.author: Vicky Whitney

card.note: I have so enjoyed working with you! I have always appreciated your friendliness and humor. You will be missed. Thank you for all you have given to Wayside and non-profits. I always think of you when I am reading a good mystery!
card.author: Taylor O'Connor

card.note: It has been a pleasure working with you. I admire your work ethic, professionalism and dedication to WW and the huge responsibility you held. You did what it took and truly made a difference. And you did it with a smile. Dance on into the next stage of your life!
card.author: Connie Bonovich

card.note: Congratulations on your retirement and your wonderful career of transforming the lives of both people and animals. We are all so fortunate to have known your class, kindness and humor and you have left an indelible mark on our hearts. Best wishes in all your endeavors!
card.author: Geoff Hall

card.note: Your caring heart and strong spirit have contributed to your successful career in creating a better community! Others with your talents are drawn to vocations that bring in the "big bucks." Instead, what you have given this world is priceless! Enjoy your retirement!!
card.author: Allison Basinger

card.note: Marilyn, we are all so thankful to you for the tireless and diligent work you've put into Wayside Waifs over the years. It has had a direct impact on making it possible for thousands of pets to find new, loving homes. All the very best to you.
card.author: John Goodman

card.note: Congratulations on your retirement, dear friend! I am so envious you beat me to it! You have been a wonderful friend for 15+ years. Your caring & unrivalled common sense helped me thru some tough times. Also, thank you for Jack & Stephanie Plum! Hugs to you!
card.author: Virginia

card.note: You are irreplaceable and will be missed by humans and the waifs alike!! You always made me feel like I mattered something special when I began as a volunteer and I continue to think of you when snuggling the doggies. You will be a hard act to follow!
card.author: Donna Williams

card.note: Marilyn - your commitment, leadership, and belief has saved the lives of thousands of shelter pets. Thank you for everything and don't be a stranger!
card.author: Robin & Alfie Rowland

card.note: It always hurts to lose that one best person, who leads the pack at work and gets everything done. The person who moves ahead and takes everyone else along, who builds a winning team by making everyone strong. Congratulations on you retirement. You will be missed!
card.author: Debbie Brown

card.note: I've enjoyed knowing you all these years clogging. And I'm happy that you will still be clogging with us in the future./R/RYour dancing friend, /REllie Behrmann
card.author: Ellie Behrmann
